thread.section_title: New Orleans Science & Technology News - NOLA.com
thread.title: NASA to announce major 'Mars mystery solved'
thread.title_full: NASA to announce major 'Mars mystery solved' | NOLA.com

author: Heather Nolan, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: NASA to announce major 'Mars mystery solved'
text:
NASA said it plans to announce a "major science finding" from its ongoing exploration of Mars at a news conference in Washington Monday (Sept. 28) morning.
The agency provided little details about what will be discussed at the news conference. A press release announcing the news conference was titled "Mars mystery solved."
Those scheduled to participate include:
Jim Green, director of planetary science at NASA Headquarters Michael Meyer, lead scientist for the Mars Exploration Program at NASA Headquarters Lujendra Ojha of the Georgia Institute of Technology in Atlanta Mary Beth Wilhelm of NASA's Ames Research Center in Moffett Field, California and the Georgia Institute of Technology Alfred McEwen, principal investigator for the High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment (HiRISE) at the University of Arizona in Tucson The event will be held at NASA's headquarters in Washington, and also will be broadcast live on the agency's website .
